intro.description:
This cheat sheet will demonstrate how create a RCP application.
To learn more about using cheat sheets, click the help button in the top right corner (?).

item.title: Open the plug-in editor
item.description:
To open the plug-in editor (if it is not already open), expand the org.eclipsecon.browser tree dialog in the Package Explorer view and double-click on the plugin.xml file (the Extensions page should be open initially).
Alternatively, click the following button to perform the task.

item.title: Define an application extension
item.description: To define an application extension, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: Click the "Add" button to open the "New Extension" wizard
Select "org.eclipse.core.runtime.applications" from the "Extension Points" list box and click "Finish"
Set the contents of the "ID" field to "application"

item.title: Add an application
item.description: To define an application, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: Select "org.eclipse.ui.perspectives" in the list box under "All Extensions" heading in the "Extensions" page
Right-click and select "New->application" from the context menu
Select "(application)" under "org.eclipse.core.runtime.applications" in the list box under "All Extensions" heading in the "Extensions" page
Right-click and select "New->run" from the context menu
Replace the content of the "class" text box with "org.eclipsecon.browser.application.Application"

item.title: Test the plug-in
item.description: To test your Eclipse plug-in inside a target Eclipse platform, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: Open the plug-in editor for the "org.eclipsecon.browser" plug-in and select the "Overview" tab
Click the "Launch an Eclipse application" hyperlink under the "Testing" heading
Select "File->Exit" from the main menu to exit the target Eclipse platform
